review_blob:
After corking into a snifter and examining my notes to other reviews I felt I was drinking a different beer than others. The Pour was dark brown with barely a hint of highlighting at all. The head was thin and quickly dissipated with very soft lacing. Aromas of roasted malt and a certain woodiness above and almost coffee-like presence. It drank smooth and fully, but not overly, carbonated. Its flavor was at once woody and sweet with a grassy bitterness backed by a strong chocolate malt with a subtle spice to it, finishing tannic and mildly bitter.  

Overall a very interesting brew but Im just not sold on it yet, maybe with some aging and rounding out of flavors itll improve.  Also, I expect this beer to be refermented and saw no evidence of yeast in the bottle.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Dogfish Head Life & Limb

review_blob: Pours quite black with a thin cream colored head. Aromas were of roasted chocolate malts and coffee with a light flora background. Mouth feel was oily but not heavy and lightly carbonated. The flavor was forward with chocolate, roasted malt, and caramel. I felt it had a vanilla and liquorice-like undertone to it and was reminiscent of plum.

Pours from the bottle dark brown to black, with a thin beige head and moderate lacing. strong aromas of butterscotch, burnt caramel, vanilla bean and a slight hint of flora citrus and alcohol. The body was mid oily and finished almost too carbonated. Forward flavor matched the aromas being backed by roasty almost coffee like malt and a stronger, zestier hop and alcohol presence. overall, Delicious
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Creme Brulee Stout
